page.title: 15Ecology of Yewdale 1
page.content: The{climate}of the area is largely governed by its position at the mountainous head of a long valley which opens to the sea. {Rainfall steadily increases from 889 mm at the coast to 2794 mm at nearby Great Langdale. As the soil is thin, and the rocks impervious, there is a rapid run-off and temporary floods can occur. The winter months have heavy rainfall, but August is the month of the secondary maximum - a fact often forgotten by tourists ! {Snow}is not a major problem in the valleys, and these are often clear when there is a great deal of snow on the fell tops.{Daytime temperatures range from about 15C in July to about 3C in January in the valleys.{Aspect has a considerable effect on temperature, and thus many farms are sited on south-facing slopes.
